sentences.en: Arranged chronologically, it begins with the novel’s primordial period — everything up to 1800 — and then marches century by century into the present.
sentences.cn: 按年代排列，它开始于小说的产生时期--一切回溯到1800年--然后一个世纪一个世界的进行到现在。
按照年代算,他年龄更大.

sentences.en: I arranged the Blind and World decks chronologically. Now all the good stuff comes first.
sentences.cn: 我按序安排了窗帘和世界甲板. 现在,所有好东西先来.

sentences.en: Manuscripts show cases arranged topically not chronologically.
sentences.cn: 从原稿看案例是按专题安排的而不是按年代次序安排的.

sentences.en: Sultex reports the L 5500's chronologically controlled, freely programmable starting mark preventer helps ensure faultless fabric quality.
sentences.cn: 苏尔寿称它的L5500机器带有序时控制 、 能自由编程的开车痕阻止器,以确保织物优质无疵.
展览是按年代先后布置的。
展览品是按年月顺序陈列的.

sentences.en: The show moves chronologically, from his earliest monochromatic canvasses to his sponges Anthropom é tries and fire paintings.
sentences.cn: 此次展出的作品按年代排序, 从他最早的单色油画到他的海绵画、“人体测量学”和火画.

sentences.en: There's no denying that as we age chronologically, our body ages right along with us.
sentences.cn: 毫无疑问,随着我们逐渐变老, 我们的身体也同时在变老.

sentences.en: This means that data may appear two or more times in the log, but as the log is chronologically advancing, the most recent data is viewed as the active data.
sentences.cn: 这意味着数据可能在日志中出现两次或更多次，但是由于日志是按时间先后顺序发展的，最近的数据被视作活动数据。

words.tran_cn: 按年代顺序排列的；依时间前后排列而记载的
[统计] 按年代排列；作年表

trans.tran_cn: 按时间的前后顺序排列地
